form.name: form1

span.div: The Greene Central School will be closed to students from 3/16/2020 - 5/15/2020 due to the Coronavirus.
The district will post up-to-date Coronavirus information here (click here), in addition to sending our global connect calls, when appropriate.

img.alt: Photo of MS students forming a G on the turf

img.title: Photo of stadium lights
img.span: GCS Joining in National Tribute to Seniors

br.span: Greene Central School will be joining the National Federation of State High Schools in a tribute to seniors. They have asked schools all over the country to turn on their field lights at 8:20 (20:20 military time) for 20 min. and 20 sec. as a tribute to the class of 2020. This is in support of all the opportunities they have missed this year. We will turn on our stadium lights each weeknight at 8:20 in support of the GCS class of 2020. This is just one more inexpensive way the district can show our support for our graduating class.

div.a: GCS Wants To Hear From You!

br.span: We need your input on the district’s response to the COVID-19 Crises to improve on the district’s communication procedures and to support future situations. To gather your feedback, we're using a tool called Thoughtexchange. It is an awesome tool. All of our voices matter, so your participation is crucial and valued.

span.div: We are sure that everyone has questions and concerns regarding COVID-19, and the impact it may or may not have on our school. We want our families and community to have access to the most up-to-date information as it becomes available. (Click the link below).
We have created a page on the district website that will serve as a one-stop location for information and updates. The page will be updated as any new information becomes available.
As alway, our superintendent Tim Calice is available for question and concerns. The best way to reach him is via email. [email protected]

div.strong: There are two important updates that the Middle School would like to share with families:

span.div: The homework hotline can now be found on the Greene Middle School Webpage. The homework hotline links are setup by grade level and can be found on the right hand column of the Greene Middle School page.
Additionally, this link https://www.loom.com/share/5655c2fcfdba4b6e9b766362f1b51dd2 will take you to a helpful video that shows you how to find and access the new homework hotline!

div.strong: Important update on 10-week courses at Greene Middle School:

span.div: Students will remain in the same 10 week classes for the 4th quarter that they were in prior to the school closure (not rotating to a new class). This decision was made to keep things as consistent as possible for students and families during these challenging times.

div.a: Extended Closure Learning Plans and Materials - April 13th

br.span: Superintendent Calice posted a Community Letter on 4/13/2020, indicating plans for continuity of learning and plans for material pick up for students. Material pick up and school work drop off for students in grades UPK - 5th grade will be available on Thursday, April 16 from 3:00-6:00pm at the primary and intermediate schools. We have a few students in the MS/HS who are using paper packets. We will have updated packets delivered to their homes next week.

div.a: New York State of Health - Special Enrollment for Health Insurance Coverage

span.span: With the closure of many businesses accross the state, many New Yorkers are at risk of losing their health insurance coverage as a result of the COVID-19. Many are likely to be eligible for health insurance with financial assistance through New York State of Health due to loss of coverage/income, and a special enrollment period for people who are uninsured was opened last month.

img.title: Group Photo of Face Shield Donation
img.alt: Group Photo of Face Shield Donation
img.a: Greene Technology Teacher, With Help From Greene Rotary Club, Makes Face Shields For Greene EMS

span.div: GREENE - Greene High School/Middle School Technology teacher Jonathan Bogardus, with a huge donation from Greene Rotary Club, is helping stem the COVID-19 virus locally by making face shields for Greene EMS. By Wednesday, Bogardus had produced 39 face shields with more planned.
“I’m cranking them out as fast as I can,” Bogardus said.

div.span: Extended School Closure and Regents Announcement - April 6

span.span: pdates from Governor Cuomo, as well as the New York State Board of Regents. During today’s press conference, Governor Cuomo announced that schools are closed until April 29

. The New York State Board of Regents has also announced that the June Regents Exams have been cancelled. No further datails have been shared at this time. The Board of Regents will be sharing some additional clarification on these items and more tomorrow.

div.a: Greene Central School COVID -19 School Closure March 31st Update

br.span:
We undertand that there are many questions and concerns regarding COVID-19, and the impact it is having on our school. We have created an update to answer many of the questions that are impacting our students daily. We ask that you go to our Coronavirus resource page and read the March 31st Superintendent update. We understand the update is lengthy but we encourage you to read it in its entirety. We have also attached the document to this news article.
CORONAVIRUS RESOURCE PAGE

span.span: As we enter our 2nd full week of school closure we want to remind you of a few important supports we have in place. The

span.style: font-size: 12pt; line-height: 107%;font-family:Times New Roman, serif; color: #222222

span.span: district will continue to provide meal service to the GCS community. Please click on the title to see the full letter.

span.div: Kindergarten registration packets have been mailed to all Kindergarten eligible students that we are aware of. If you have a student that will be eligible(5 years of age by 12/1/2020), and you have not received a packet please either print one and return it to the Primary School Office, or contact the office at (607)656-4161. You may also contact Mrs. Anderson via email at [email protected] Registration paperwork is due back by Friday, February 28th.
View full article for more important information.

div.a: Personalize your access and notifications from GCS

span.div: If you want to receive text and/or email notifications of school closings, delays, news postings, blog updates, plus much more..

Registering for a public user account online will allow you to set up a customized dashboard of closings, news, events and blog updates for the schools and departments you are interested in. In addition, you enable us to communicate with you via email newsletters and (optionally) text messages. Please click on the link to the left "e-communications" to enroll.

img.title: Earn Cash for Our School
img.a: Box Tops For Education to Support Our School

p.span: Did you know that every Boxtop equals a dime? That’s right! When you clip a Boxtop and send it in with your child, our school earns 10 cents.
Here in Greene three buildings use this program to raise funds. For example, the middle school uses the money for student breakfasts during the state ELA and math assessments

span.span: The Greene Central School District recognizes that the safety of our children is a responsibility of the entire community.

The school district occasionally receives notification from the Chenango County Sheriff's Department or other law enforcement agencies about convicted sex offenders who reside within our school district boundaries. Upon receipt of such notification, the district will notify staff members, place the information at each school/district office and post an information alert on the district homepage.

div.a: GCS has Created Official Facebook and Twitter Accounts

br.span: The Greene Central School District has created Facebook and Twitter accounts to increase communication with our community. Please follow us on Twitter and Like our Facebook page. We will use these to communicate important events, as well as share many of the great things happening here at GCS.

div.a: GCS is Excited to Offer eSchoolPLUS Family App

br.span: Now you can access school information from mobile devices using the eSchoolPLUS Family app. Use the app to view attendance, classwork, class and activity calendars, and student grades. Also, send an email to a teacher by tapping the teacher's name. All of this from your favorite mobile device!

div.a: Annual Budget Hearing and BOE Meeting 6:00 POSTPONED
School Budget VOTE & BOE Member Election 11:00 - 8:00 POSTPONED
Primary School End of Year Show
